it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.cards

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.cards.Card
      • it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.cards.Weapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseFightAction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Heatseeker, TwoEffectWeapon, Whisper

    public abstract class Weapon
extends Card
    Class that implements the abstracts weapons with only one base effects
    Author:
    Federico Innocente

    • Method Detail

      • updateUsableEffect

        public void updateUsableEffect(boolean[] newUsableEffect)
        Method to reset the usable effect for the weapon in a determinate moment
        Parameters:
        newUsableEffect - is the new configuration of the usable effectcs

      • performEffect

        public void performEffect(int selectedEffect,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Object> targets)
        Method called to perform an effect. It can preform only an effect that is enabled for that weapon, otherwise throw an exception
        Parameters:
        selectedEffect - is the selected effect
        targets - are the targets of the effect, that could be character o square alternatively (depends of the effect)

      • getTargetEffect

        public ControllerViewEvent getTargetEffect(int selectedEffect)
        Get all the possible target of the effect, which could be both squares or players, and return a message ready to be send to the clients for the choice. Only effects enabled for the weapons can be requested.
        Parameters:
        selectedEffect - is the effect which targets are requested
        Returns:
        a message with the information about all possible targets of the effetc

      • isUsableEffect

        public boolean isUsableEffect(int selectedEffect)
        Check if an effect can be correctly used. That means that teh effect must be enabled, the player can pay for it and that it has targets in range. Only enabled effects can be checked
        Parameters:
        selectedEffect - is the selected effect
        Returns:
        true if the effect is usable, false otherwise

      • setUsableEffect

        protected void setUsableEffect()
        Set the usable effects. This method is called in the reloading phase of the weapon to set the effects that the player can use at teh start of the shot action

      • isUsable

        public boolean isUsable()
        Check if the weapon is usable. To be usable, the weapon must be loaded and at least one of its effects must be correctly usable
        Returns:
        true if the weapon is usable, false otherwise

      • effectControlFlow

        public void effectControlFlow(int effectUsed)
        Manage the flow of the effects after using one, setting the once that are usable or less. Some effects are only usable before or after other specific effects.
        Parameters:
        effectUsed - is the last effect used

      • performEffectOne

        public abstract void performEffectOne(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> targets)
        Perform the basic effect of the weapon
        Parameters:
        targets - are the targets chosen by the player

      • getTargetEffectOne

        public abstract ControllerViewEvent getTargetEffectOne()
        Calculate all the possible targets of the basic effect (which could be squares or players) and encode them into a message ready to be send to the player .
        Returns:
        a message with all teh information about teh possible targets

      • isUsableEffectOne

        public boolean isUsableEffectOne()
        Check if the basic effect is usable in the current condition. That means that teh effect must be enabled, the player can pay for it and that it has targets in range.
        Returns:
        true if the effect can be performed, false otherwise

      • hasToPay

        public boolean hasToPay(int effect)
        Check if an effect has to be payed or less. That's because some effects can be performed on more steps, but has to payed just once
        Parameters:
        effect - is the checked effect
        Returns:
        true if the effect has to be payed, false otherwise

      • getEffectCost

        public AmmoCube[] getEffectCost(int effect)
        Get the cost of an effect. Only enabled effect can have a cost
        Parameters:
        effect - is the effect which cost is searched
        Returns:
        the cost of the effect

      • checkEmptyTargets

        public void checkEmptyTargets(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> targets)
        Check that the target list of an effect is not empty If it is, throw an IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        targets - is the list of the targets passed to an effect

      • resetDamagedplayer

        public void resetDamagedplayer()
        Reset the list of the players damaged by the weapon

        Getter method
        Returns:
